title.narrative: PlanBørnefonden - NGO call Sahel 2021-2023

description.narrative: PlanBørnefonden - NGO call Sahel 2021-2023 - Internally Displaced Persons and host communities affected by the complex humanitarian crisis in Northern and Eastern Burkina Faso have their critical needs met and strengthened their resilience through more sustainable livelihoods, improved protection, and access to quality education services

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: Children, adolescents, and youth from vulnerable households affected by the crisis have more sustainable livelihoods, strengthened economic empowerment and improved food security
% (and #) of young women and men with an own operational business/income generating activity within 6 months after training

target.value:
3960 young women and men have completed SOYEE trainings
80 % of young women and men who completed SOYEE trainings have established their own operational business/income generating activity

title.narrative: Children, adolescents, and youth, including out of school children, have increased access to formal inclusive quality education through re-enforced schools including WASH
- % of targeted children, adolescents, and youth (females and males) who have access to quality education at the end of the action, including those living with disabilities

Crisis affected children, adolescents and youth are protected from sexual and gender-based violence, abuse, neglect, and exploitation and survivors have access to quality protection services and psychosocial support
- % of reported cases (from girls and boys) receiving appropriate and timely services and/or referrals
Child and Youth Friendly spaces are established/strengthened to respond to immediate protection needs of children, adolescents and youth affected by the crisis

- # of children, adolescents, and youth (females and males) registered attending Child-Friendly Spaces and Youth Clubs - # Child protection actors (females and males) trained on case management and monitoring of referral systems

target.value:
16800 children, adolescents, and youth (females and males) are registered attending Child-Friendly Spaces and Youth Clubs
200 Child protection actors (females and males) are trained on case management and monitoring of referral systems

title.narrative: Social service providers and community-based mechanisms are strengthened to identify, prevent, and respond to protection issues including SGBV and provide support to children, adolescents, and youth.

- # of targeted Community-based child protection mechanisms (CBCPM) that are functional and actively identifying, reporting, referring, and following-up on CP cases - % of Ministry of Social Affairs (MoSA) decentralized offices in the targeted areas who report increased capacities to manage protection and SGBV services based on needs

target.value:
23 CBCPM groups that are functional and actively identifying, reporting, referring, and following-up on CP cases
70% of MoSA decentralized offices in the targeted areas report increased capacities to manage protection and SGBV services based on needs

23 CBCPM groups that are functional and actively identifying, reporting, referring, and following-up on CP cases
60% of MoSA decentralized offices in the targeted areas report increased capacities to manage protection and SGBV services based on needs

23 CBCPM groups that are functional and actively identifying, reporting, referring, and following-up on CP cases
65% of MoSA decentralized offices in the targeted areas report increased capacities to manage protection and SGBV services based on needs

title.narrative: Children, adolescents, and youth, including out of school children, have increased access to formal inclusive quality education through re-enforced schools including WASH

3200 vulnerable students (females and males) who received back-to-school fees

title.narrative: Children, adolescents, youth as well as teachers, school managers, and local community-based organizations implement conflict-sensitive school management approaches and build resilient learning environments

- # of trained members of School Management Committees (SMCs), PTAs (Parent, Teacher Associations) and CBCPM (females and males), on their roles and responsibilities to promote inclusive, gender and conflict-sensitive school management approach - # of actions plans made to address risks and vulnerabilities specific to each school by students, teachers, APE/AME and MENAPLN's decentralized structures

target.value:
300 members of SMCs, PTAs and CBCPMs (females and males) are trained on DRR, including security, sanitary, naturel risks to promote inclusive, gender and conflict-sensitive school management approach
100 of actions plans have been made to address risks and vulnerabilities specific to each school

title.narrative: Children, adolescents, youth, and teachers benefit from enhanced, innovative, and culturally appropriate models of education, accelerated learning programs and learning through temporary learning spaces

- # of vulnerable students (females and males) who receive adequate support to access and progress within accelerated learning programs (SSA/P SSA/2) - # of TLS learning spaces established and functioning - % (and #) of trained teachers (females and males) report that they have received adequate training and support to deliver the curriculum well

target.value:
2250 vulnerable students (females and males) receive adequate support to access and progress within accelerated learning programs
30 of TLS learning spaces established and functioning
80% of 300 trained teachers (females and males) report that they have received adequate training and support to deliver the curriculum well

15 of TLS learning spaces established and functioning
80% of 150 trained teachers (females and males) report that they have received adequate training and support to deliver the curriculum well

title.narrative: Young people, especially young women affected by the crisis build on and develop their skills for self-employment opportunities.

- % (and #) of young women and men who report at the end of the training feeling confident about their life skills - % (and #) of young women and men who demonstrate at the end of the training entrepreneurial competencies - # of young women and men actively participating in VSLAs

target.value:
80% of 3960 young women and men report at the end of the training feeling confident about their life skills
80% of 3960 young women and men who demonstrate at the end of the training entrepreneurial competencies
4500 young women and men actively participate in VSLAs

80% of 1320 young women and men report at the end of the training feeling confident about their life skills

1500 young women and men actively participate in VSLAs
